chapter.title: Telemetry command-line client
chapter.para:
The ceilometer client is the command-line interface (CLI) for the Telemetry API and its extensions.
This chapter documents ceilometer version 1.0.13.
For help on a specific ceilometer command, enter:

listitem.para: Create a new alarm based on state of other alarms.
Update an existing alarm based on state of other alarms.
Create a new alarm (Deprecated). Use alarm- threshold-create instead.
Delete an alarm.
Create a new alarm based on computed statistics.
Update an existing alarm based on computed statistics.
Create a new alarm based on computed statistics.
Update an existing alarm based on computed statistics.
Display the change history of an alarm.
List the user's alarms.
Show an alarm.
Get the state of an alarm.
Set the state of an alarm.
Create a new alarm based on computed statistics.
Update an existing alarm based on computed statistics.
Update an existing alarm (Deprecated).
List events.
Show a particular event.
List event types.
List the user's meters.
Query Alarm History.
Query Alarms.
Query samples.
List the resources.
Show the resource.
Create a sample.
List the samples (return OldSample objects if -m/--meter is set).
Show an sample.
List the statistics for a meter.
List trait info for an event type.
List all traits with name <trait_name> for Event Type <event_type>.
Prints all of the commands and options to stdout.
Display help about this program or one of its subcommands.
show program's version number and exit
Defaults to env[CEILOMETERCLIENT_DEBUG].
Print more verbose output.
Number of seconds to wait for a response.
DEPRECATED, use --os-endpoint instead. Defaults to env[CEILOMETER_URL].
Defaults to env[CEILOMETER_API_VERSION] or 2.
Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_ID].
Defaults to env[OS_REGION_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_TOKEN].
Defaults to env[OS_SERVICE_TYPE].
Defaults to env[OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE].
Defaults to env[OS_CACERT].
Defaults to env[OS_INSECURE].
Defaults to env[OS_CERT_FILE].
Defaults to env[OS_KEY_FILE].
Defaults to env[OS_CERT].
Defaults to env[OS_KEY].
Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_PROJECT_ID].
Defaults to env[OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID].
Defaults to env[OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_ENDPOINT].
Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_SYSTEM].
Defaults to env[OS_USERNAME].
Defaults to env[OS_PASSWORD].
Defaults to env[OS_TENANT_NAME].
Defaults to env[OS_TOKEN].
Defaults to env[OS_AUTH_URL].

section.title: ceilometer alarm-combination-create

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-combination-create --name <NAME> [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] --alarm_ids <ALARM IDS> [--operator <OPERATOR>] [--repeat-actions {True|False}]

section.para: Create a new alarm based on state of other alarms.

listitem.para: Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant). Required.
Tenant to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
List of alarm IDs. Required.
Operator to compare with, one of: ['and', 'or'].
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state. Defaults to False.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-combination-update

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-combination-update [--name <NAME>] [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] [--remove-time-constraint <Constraint names>] [--alarm_ids <ALARM IDS>] [--operator <OPERATOR>] [--repeat-actions {True|False}] [<ALARM_ID>]

section.para: Update an existing alarm based on state of other alarms.

listitem.para: ID of the alarm to update.
Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant).
Tenant to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Name or list of names of the time constraints to remove.
List of alarm IDs.
Operator to compare with, one of: ['and', 'or'].
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-delete
section.para: Delete an alarm.

listitem.para: ID of the alarm to delete.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-metrics-threshold-create

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-metrics-threshold-create --name <NAME> [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] [--granularity <GRANULARITY>] [--evaluation-periods <COUNT>] [--aggregation-method <AGGREATION>] [--comparison-operator <OPERATOR>] --threshold <THRESHOLD> [--repeat-actions {True|False}] -m <METRICS>

section.para: Create a new alarm based on computed statistics.

listitem.para: Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant). Required.
Tenant to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Length of each period (seconds) to evaluate over.
Number of periods to evaluate over.
Aggregation method to use, one of: ['max', 'min', 'avg', 'sum', 'count'].
Operator to compare with, one of: ['lt', 'le', 'eq', 'ne', 'ge', 'gt'].
Threshold to evaluate against. Required.
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state. Defaults to False.
Metric to evaluate against. Required.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-metrics-threshold-update

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-metrics-threshold-update [--name <NAME>] [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] [--granularity <GRANULARITY>] [--evaluation-periods <COUNT>] [--aggregation-method <AGGREATION>] [--comparison-operator <OPERATOR>] [--threshold <THRESHOLD>] [--repeat-actions {True|False}] [-m <METRICS>] [--remove-time-constraint <Constraint names>] [<ALARM_ID>]

listitem.para: ID of the alarm to update.

Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Length of each period (seconds) to evaluate over.
Number of periods to evaluate over.
Aggregation method to use, one of: ['max', 'min', 'avg', 'sum', 'count'].
Operator to compare with, one of: ['lt', 'le', 'eq', 'ne', 'ge', 'gt'].
Threshold to evaluate against.
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state. Defaults to False.

Name or list of names of the time constraints to remove.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-resources-threshold-create

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-resources-threshold-create --name <NAME> [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] [--granularity <GRANULARITY>] [--evaluation-periods <COUNT>] [--aggregation-method <AGGREATION>] [--comparison-operator <OPERATOR>] --threshold <THRESHOLD> [--repeat-actions {True|False}] -m <METRIC> --resource-type <RESOURCE_TYPE> --resource-constraint <RESOURCE_CONSTRAINT>

section.para: Create a new alarm based on computed statistics.

listitem.para: Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant). Required.
Tenant to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Length of each period (seconds) to evaluate over.
Number of periods to evaluate over.
Aggregation method to use, one of: ['max', 'min', 'avg', 'sum', 'count'].
Operator to compare with, one of: ['lt', 'le', 'eq', 'ne', 'ge', 'gt'].
Threshold to evaluate against. Required.
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state. Defaults to False.
Metric to evaluate against. Required.
Resource_type to evaluate against. Required.
Resources to evaluate against or a expression to select multiple resources. Required.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-resources-threshold-update

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-gnocchi-resources-threshold-update [--name <NAME>] [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] [--granularity <GRANULARITY>] [--evaluation-periods <COUNT>] [--aggregation-method <AGGREATION>] [--comparison-operator <OPERATOR>] [--threshold <THRESHOLD>] [--repeat-actions {True|False}] [-m <METRIC>] [--resource-type <RESOURCE_TYPE>] [--resource-constraint <RESOURCE_CONSTRAINT>] [--remove-time-constraint <Constraint names>] [<ALARM_ID>]

listitem.para: ID of the alarm to update.
Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant).

Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Length of each period (seconds) to evaluate over.
Number of periods to evaluate over.
Aggregation method to use, one of: ['max', 'min', 'avg', 'sum', 'count'].
Operator to compare with, one of: ['lt', 'le', 'eq', 'ne', 'ge', 'gt'].
Threshold to evaluate against.
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state. Defaults to False.
Metric to evaluate against.
Resource_type to evaluate against.
Resources to evaluate against or a expression to select multiple resources.
Name or list of names of the time constraints to remove.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-history
section.para: Display the change history of an alarm.

listitem.para: ID of the alarm for which history is shown.
key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-list
section.para: List the user's alarms.

listitem.para: key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-show
section.para: Show an alarm.

listitem.para: ID of the alarm to show.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-state-get
section.para: Get the state of an alarm.

listitem.para: ID of the alarm state to show.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-state-set
section.para: Set the state of an alarm.

listitem.para: ID of the alarm state to set.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']. Required.

section.title: ceilometer alarm-threshold-create

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-threshold-create --name <NAME> [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] -m <METRIC> [--period <PERIOD>] [--evaluation-periods <COUNT>] [--statistic <STATISTIC>] [--comparison-operator <OPERATOR>] --threshold <THRESHOLD> [-q <QUERY>] [--repeat-actions {True|False}]

section.para: Create a new alarm based on computed statistics.

listitem.para: Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant). Required.
Tenant to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Metric to evaluate against. Required.
Length of each period (seconds) to evaluate over.
Number of periods to evaluate over.
Statistic to evaluate, one of: ['max', 'min', 'avg', 'sum', 'count'].
Operator to compare with, one of: ['lt', 'le', 'eq', 'ne', 'ge', 'gt'].
Threshold to evaluate against. Required.
key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state. Defaults to False.

to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. section.title: ceilometer alarm-update

screen.computeroutput: usage: ceilometer alarm-update [--name <NAME>] [--project-id <PROJECT_ID>] [--user-id <USER_ID>] [--description <DESCRIPTION>] [--state <STATE>] [--severity <SEVERITY>] [--enabled {True|False}] [--alarm-action <Webhook URL>] [--ok-action <Webhook URL>] [--insufficient-data-action <Webhook URL>] [--time-constraint <Time Constraint>] [--remove-time-constraint <Constraint names>] [--period <PERIOD>] [--evaluation-periods <COUNT>] [-m <METRIC>] [--statistic <STATISTIC>] [--comparison-operator <OPERATOR>] [--threshold <THRESHOLD>] [--matching-metadata <Matching Metadata>] [--repeat-actions {True|False}] [<ALARM_ID>]

section.para: Update an existing alarm (Deprecated).

listitem.para: ID of the alarm to update.
Name of the alarm (must be unique per tenant).
Tenant to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with alarm (only settable by admin users).
Free text description of the alarm.
State of the alarm, one of: ['ok', 'alarm', 'insufficient data']
Severity of the alarm, one of: ['low', 'moderate', 'critical']
True if alarm evaluation/actioning is enabled.
to invoke when state transitions to alarm. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
to invoke when state transitions to OK. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.
URL to invoke when state transitions to insufficient data. May be used multiple times. Defaults to None.

Only evaluate the alarm if the time at evaluation is within this time constraint. Start point(s) of the constraint are specified with a cron expression, whereas its duration is given in seconds. Can be specified multiple times for multiple time constraints, format is: name=<CONSTRAINT_NAME>;start=<CRON>;durati on=<SECONDS>;[description=<DESCRIPTION>;[timez one=<IANA Timezone>]] Defaults to None.
Name or list of names of the time constraints to remove.
Length of each period (seconds) to evaluate over.
Number of periods to evaluate over.
Metric to evaluate against.
Statistic to evaluate, one of: ['max', 'min', 'avg', 'sum', 'count']
Operator to compare with, one of: ['lt', 'le', 'eq', 'ne', 'ge', 'gt'].
Threshold to evaluate against.
A meter should match this resource metadata (key=value) additionally to the meter_name. Defaults to None.
True if actions should be repeatedly notified while alarm remains in target state.

section.title: ceilometer event-list
section.para: List events.

listitem.para: key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, floator datetime.
If specified, traits will not be printed.

section.title: ceilometer event-show
section.para: Show a particular event.

listitem.para: The ID of the event. Should be a UUID.

section.title: ceilometer event-type-list
section.para: List event types.

section.title: ceilometer meter-list
section.para: List the user's meters.

listitem.para: key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.

section.title: ceilometer query-alarm-history
section.para: Query Alarm History.

listitem.para: {complex_op: [{simple_op: {field_name: value}}]} The complex_op is one of: ['and', 'or'], simple_op is one of: ['=', '!=', '<', '<=', '>', '>='].
[{field_name: direction}, {field_name: direction}] The direction is one of: ['asc', 'desc'].
Maximum number of alarm history items to return.

section.title: ceilometer query-alarms
section.para: Query Alarms.

listitem.para: {complex_op: [{simple_op: {field_name: value}}]} The complex_op is one of: ['and', 'or'], simple_op is one of: ['=', '!=', '<', '<=', '>', '>='].
[{field_name: direction}, {field_name: direction}] The direction is one of: ['asc', 'desc'].
Maximum number of alarms to return.

section.title: ceilometer query-samples
section.para: Query samples.

listitem.para: {complex_op: [{simple_op: {field_name: value}}]} The complex_op is one of: ['and', 'or'], simple_op is one of: ['=', '!=', '<', '<=', '>', '>='].
[{field_name: direction}, {field_name: direction}] The direction is one of: ['asc', 'desc'].
Maximum number of samples to return.

section.title: ceilometer resource-list
section.para: List the resources.

listitem.para: key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.

section.title: ceilometer resource-show
section.para: Show the resource.

listitem.para: ID of the resource to show.

section.title: ceilometer sample-create
section.para: Create a sample.

listitem.para: Tenant to associate with sample (only settable by admin users).
User to associate with sample (only settable by admin users).
ID of the resource. Required.
The meter name. Required.
The meter type. Required.
The meter unit. Required.
The sample volume. Required.
Resource metadata. Provided value should be a set of key-value pairs e.g. {"key":"value"}.
The sample timestamp.

section.title: ceilometer sample-list
section.para: List the samples (return OldSample objects if -m/--meter is set).

listitem.para: key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.
Name of meter to show samples for.
Maximum number of samples to return.

section.title: ceilometer sample-show
section.para: Show an sample.

listitem.para: ID (aka message ID) of the sample to show.

section.title: ceilometer statistics
section.para: List the statistics for a meter.

listitem.para: key[op]data_type::value; list. data_type is optional, but if supplied must be string, integer, float, or boolean.
Name of meter to list statistics for. Required.
Period in seconds over which to group samples.
Field for group by.
Function for data aggregation. Available aggregates are: count, cardinality, min, max, sum, stddev, avg. Defaults to [].

section.title: ceilometer trait-description-list
section.para: List trait info for an event type.

listitem.para: Type of the event for which traits will be shown. Required.

section.title: ceilometer trait-list
section.para: List all traits with name <trait_name> for Event Type <event_type>.

listitem.para: Type of the event for which traits will listed. Required.
The name of the trait to list. Required.
